$interpreted: Tica: Umm, Elio... No, no, I mean Professor Dietrich, you in there? Can Tica come in?
Morris: ...Who is it?
Tica: Headmaster Balzac told me to come here~
Tica: Wah~Pulling me in like that, scared the Soul Energy right outta me!
Morris: Hmph. You're not the only one. Not a perfect landing, but close. What's your full name?
Tica: Professor Dietrich, good day to you sir~We met yesterday. My name is Tica Chevalier, I came to...
Morris: Record data on Crystal transformation. Balzac told me.
Morris: What are you doing just standing around? Come help.
Tica: Eh? What should I do?
Morris: What do you think? Help me take my clothes off, of course. Two people will be much much efficient than one.
Tica: Eh? Ehhhhh? EEEHHHHHHHH!?!?!?
Morris: It's freezing in here. Hurry it up, Chevalier.
Tica: I-I can't measure very well with my eyes closed...
Morris: The more precise the measurements, the more valuable the experiment will be. The errors created by the fabric won't allow you to grasp the truth.
Tica: Tica never thought she'd have to make the first move...
Morris: How can one do research thinking about nonsense like that? Quit blabbing.
Tica: These numbers...are very interesting.
Morris: Do you mean the height and weight of this teenager, or his waistline?
Tica: No, no~I mean the viscosity of your surrounding Soul Energy! And it's so active...
Tica: Got it~I'll get the Energy Spectrometer from the sick room. It'll be able to analyze a lot more data!
Morris: Sounds like some useless Applied Magic piece of crap. Put that out of your mind and face me, Chevalier!
Tica: Eh eh~Isn't that like some super incredible invention? It can separate out different Soul Energy. Really convenient for pulling pranks.
Morris: Just like Clovis. Wasting talent carelessly.
Tica: Professor Clovis? What's the matter with him?
Morris: That dimwit only cared about bringing me back to life. Gave up on Rune research. Threw away everything I taught him.
Tica: But...you came back to life, didn't you? That was the result of all his research...
Morris: Doing research for any desire other than the desire for knowledge itself is not the attitude a scholar of Life Magic ought to have.
Morris: Deciding which type of knowledge has value before one's research has begun, deciding beforehand which type of knowledge is worth pursuing...
Morris: ...these are not the qualities of a Life Magic scholar.
Tica: Oh, is there a difference? Tica thinks they're pretty similar.
Morris: ──Take a good look, Chevalier!
Morris: The desire to pursue knowledge is man's greatest emotion.

Morris: Meticulous study, the pursuit of everything, it is all for the sake of knowledge. 

Only one with a pure heart can break through the chains that bind us and reach the other realm.
Morris: All other judgments and positions are impurities that must be cast aside!
Tica: ... No, that's not true!
Morris: You...
Tica: Clovis just wanted to save someone that was important to him. He put everything he had into the pursuit of knowledge, just for you.
Tica: Tica thinks that's a super-duper noble pursuit!
Morris: His abilities could make even greater contributions if used in other ways...
Tica: Why do you want to tell him what to do? Tica thinks people should be free to live as they please!
Morris: You little...!?
Morris: You...what's your connection to that bastard Charle?
Tica: Tica is Headmaster Charle's disciple!
Morris: ...I see. This naive sort of thinking is cut from the same mold.
Morris: What a shame. So naturally gifted...
Tica: Ey~Why you talkin' bout Headmaster Charle like that?
Annie: You hear that?
Tica: Ah, darn it! Forgot to shut the door!
Tica: Headmaster Balzac warned me like a billion, gazillion, trillion times to not let other students bust in here!
Morris: ...This type of muddle-headed personality; no different from Charle's...
Morris: You three had better not scream──

...I see. This naive sort of thinking is cut from the same mold.
What a shame. So naturally gifted...
Ey~Why you talkin' bout Headmaster Charle like that?
You hear that?
Ah, darn it! Forgot to shut the door!
